abstract: With high expectations for the tablet, Apple’s biggest challenge will be achieving the mass-market penetration and cultural impact of the iPod and iPhone.
snippet: With high expectations for the tablet, Apple’s biggest challenge will be achieving the mass-market penetration and cultural impact of the iPod and iPhone.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When the Apple iPad goes on sale on Saturday, most of the major questions surrounding the device will have been answered, save for one: can it live up to the hype?

headline.main: Analysts Ask if the iPad Can Live Up to Its Hype

abstract: Monday’s roundup of tech tidbits includes tech reporters discussing Apple versus Google, the wait for iPads and an algorithm to figure out when your favorite Twitterers may be asleep.
snippet: Monday’s roundup of tech tidbits includes tech reporters discussing Apple versus Google, the wait for iPads and an algorithm to figure out when your favorite Twitterers may be asleep.
lead_paragraph: Over the weekend, the tech reporters and editors found these articles of interest:

headline.main: What We’re Reading: IPad Orders and Twitter Sleep Schedules

abstract: With the iPad hitting the market, publishers wonder how to position their content in a new world, one that for the time being, does not include Flash.
snippet: With the iPad hitting the market, publishers wonder how to position their content in a new world, one that for the time being, does not include Flash.
lead_paragraph: As our colleague Brad Stone points out, no one knows what kind of sales the iPad will gin up out of the gate on Saturday, and it’s just as tough to guess what forms of media will be on this newest form factor in computing.

headline.main: Debate Between Media and Apple Over iPad Hardly a Flash in the Pan

abstract: Monday’s roundup of technology news includes a look at the early boom in sales of Apple’s iPad, changes at Facebook and the worst civic pitches to get free broadband from Google.
snippet: Monday’s roundup of technology news includes a look at the early boom in sales of Apple’s iPad, changes at Facebook and the worst civic pitches to get free broadband from Google.
lead_paragraph: The clickstream of the Times technology journalists is overflowing like a New York storm sewer:

headline.main: What We’re Reading: iPad Fanboys and Facebook Likeboys
